citation.article-title: Denitrobacterium detoxificans gen. nov., sp. nov., a ruminal bacterium that respires on nitrocompounds.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Denitrobacterium (De.nit.ro.bac.te'ri.um. L. pref. de from; L. n. nitro nitrocompound; Gr. neut. dim. n. bakterion a small rod; M.L. neut. n. Denitrobacterium nitrocompound-reducing rod)
Cells are rod-shaped (0.5-1.0x1.0-1.5 μm); bulbous ends may be present.
Strictly anaerobic chemoorganotroph; growth is dependent on the presence of a suitable electron acceptor and is proportional to the amount of acceptor reduced.
The G+­C content of DNA ranges from 56 to 60 mol% (thermal denaturation method).
The genus comprises a single species, Denitrobacterium detoxificans.
